climbs.name: Zen and the Art of Motorcycle Maintenance

content.description: Traverse left to right. Starts on Bad Habits with a left hand in the small pocket and right hand on the round sloping start hold for Kill Bill Vol. 2. Match the right hand and climb the first half of Kill Bill to the deep horizontal crack that runs across the entire wall at about 9-10ft high. Traverse right along the length of the crack topping out on Mother's Milk at the very end.
content.location: On the main wall. Starts on Bad Habits.

content.description: Located to the right of Kill Bill. It starts under the roof on the very right side, matched on a flat hold. There are a few okay holds and a little mono pocket under the roof. Use this to get to the horizontal rail above. Readjust and dyno for the jug just below the lip then mantle the top out.

To the right of the dyno project and No Holds BBQ. Starts where the horizontal rail sort of peters out climbs through the little arete through the rail and up on jugs. fun little route to warm up a little on.

A good variation/linkup of No Holds BBQ and Kill Bill. Starts under the roof to the right on the flat hold, the same start as No Holds BBQ. Move up to the horizontal and traverse left through a 3 finger square crimp and cross to the top out ledge of Kill Bill.

Start in the same pocket as Bad Habits and move left through jugs and finish in about the same spot as the warm up problem.  

  There is a variation to this problem that starts to the right of the pocket on the sloping rail and traverses through the pocket. It is slightly harder maybe v3+ or V4

This problem goes up the arete that is nestled into the corner where the cliff breaks toward the water. There used to be a weird pedestal to stand on at the start but it later moved and revealed a sit start which has since broken and become much harder. The stand has been climbed a few times and goes at V7/8. Follow up through some hard crimps to the top.

Sit start with hands matched on the sloping block and right foot on the corner of the sloping ledge. Move up and right through left facing side-pulls and horizontal rails. Once at the last rail, either jump feet from the sloping ledge or get a high left foot and push to the top.
Stand start version of Kill Bill Vol. 2. Start in the obvious left-facing sidepull at head head height. Flow through crimps up and right to the top!
content.protection: pads. watch the block buried in the dirt below the route could be an ankle breaker.

content.description: Send The Crescent Slab? This is your next climb!Start on a matched waist high shelf about 10-15’ right of The Crescent Slab. Follow the thin vertical seam to the top. This line has likely been done before, let me know if you have any information on it!
content.location: In between The Crescent Slab and Fat Crack. Find the small waist high shelf and a thin vertical seam.

content.description: Start matched on the garbage crimp rail, and go for the horizontal slot-rail, reach high for the lip, and top out on jugs.
content.location: Just to the right of the V-easy down-climb problem.

content.description: Climbs the tempting overhanging arete. Start with the 2 flat crimps slightly above your head. Follow the arete all the way to the top, climbing through the vertical crack and then using a small crimp on the right face.
content.location: Left-most of the climbing in the main area. On the overhanging arete.

content.description: climb the obvious vertical crack 10 feet to the left of the sketchy tree ladder. Very easy. let me know if someone already has a name for this
content.location: 10 feet to the left of the tree ladder or in the middle of the slabby portion of main wall (called "Zen Pen area" on Mnt. project)

content.description: A direct line with a cool set of power moves: one easy and one hard, both fun! Starts on a crimp rail between No Holds BBQ and Mother's Milk. Head straight up to the lip!

A good variation of the original Kill Bill lines. Start sitting on the low sloping rail and traverse through technical moves to the large left-facing sidepull. From here, split from the original problem and go left instead to a 3 finger pocket and then make one big move to the lip.

Located to the right of the pocket arete project. The northern most problem before the wall breaks toward the water. Look for the arcing crescent cut in the rock. Climb directly into it using high feet and a weird mantle/hand foot match before setting up for the no handed jump to the top. Much easier if you are tall.

Starts in the obvious pocket to the to the south of the ladder (right if you are looking at the wall from the water). Use bad feet and throw to the only other pocket on the wall and go again for the top. Fun and a little hard on the fingers.

An excellently thuggy dyno. Start on No Holds BBQ: right side under the roof on the large flat hold. Move left and through the mono undercling to the left horizontal break in the middle of the face. Set up and let fly a monster slam dunk to the very apex of the prow.
Located almost directly behind the ladder and ascends through some good crimps and jugs to the top.
The first route to the north after stepping off the ladder. There is a small slab with a big rail to start on. Throw your foot up on the rail press out the mantle and reach up for the jugs above.

This problem is a little bit further right than Marley’s Fire. It could be very hard I don't know because I haven't made it very far on it. There is a low sit start on a giant ledge that seems to slope the wrong way for the problem. Use bad feet to throw out left to a side pull and then up the face. Very difficult. Grade is very approximate.

This is where a bulk of the routes are located. Lots of grades and everything from fun slabs to fun overhangs. Good routes all around.  

  Again I don't know all the names because i haven't found a good topo from the guys who developed it all, (i am working on that though) if the name of the route is in parentheses ()  than it is just a random name i gave it and will usually just say something about what the route looks like or climbs like.
